name: 陳晏笙
objective: This course is the deepening and broadening of linear algebra. In terms of deepening the theory, this course starts with the Gaussian elimination method, explaining the four vector spaces. Next, it explains the orthogonality and projection of matrices. In addition, this course explains the determinants, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, powers and exponents of matrices, and spectral decomposition, finally concluding with singular value decomposition, which is the theorem that unifies all the contents in this semester. In terms of broadening applications, this course introduces scientific and engineering applications, such as regression analysis, linear programming, graph theory and networks, and principal component analysis.
schedule:
Week and topic:
1. Introduction - Importance of Linear Algebra
2. Ax=b, Matrix, Gaussian Elimination and Application
3. Vector Spaces and Linear Equation
4. Applications: Graphs and Networks
5. Orthogonality and Least Squares
6. Applications: Multiple Regression
7. Spring break
8. Application: Linear Programming 
9. Midterm
10. Determinant and its Applications
11. Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
12. Ak and Difference Equations
13. eA and Differential Equations
14. Similarity Transformation and Spectral Theorem
15. Positive Definite Matrices and Minimum Principles
16. Applications: Multivariate Analysis and Principal Component Analysis
17. Singular Value Decomposition and its Applications
18. Final
materials: Gilbert Strang, Linear Algebra and Its Applications, 4th Edition, Thomson, 2006.
